title: During WW2, did the Allied Air Forces ever use any Russian aircraft? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not that I know of. However, they did copy our A39 aircraft which had a door much like a car door on the right hand side. Also had a driveshaft that ran the length of the aircraft between the pilot's legs. Weird aircraft. But how many aircraft did the U.S. field during WW2.
Unsurprisingly both the Soviet Air Forces and Soviet Air Defence Forces used many Russian aircraft. As far as I know, none of the other Allied air forces used Russian aircraft.
